readme.summary: Excellent clarity about what wxWidgets is, but lacks quick-start code examples and requires users to navigate to separate platform-specific documentation for installation.
readme.top_issue: No quick-start code example showing how to create even a simple 'Hello World' GUI application

injection_risks.description: Potential for command injection in wxCrashReport::SetFileName() due to use of wxString::Format()
Use of wxLaunchDefaultBrowser() with user-controlled input (defaultDir) may lead to command injection

critical_findings: Potential for command injection in wxCrashReport::SetFileName()
Use of wxLaunchDefaultBrowser() with user-controlled input may lead to command injection
security.summary: The code has some security concerns, including potential command injection vulnerabilities and lack of input validation, but overall it appears to be well-structured and follows best practices.

common_complaints: High DPI / HiDPI display scaling issues across multiple platforms (MSW, GTK)
UI rendering inconsistencies on platform-specific controls (TreeCtrl, Toolbar, AuiNotebook)
Deprecated or problematic API design (wxDIALOG_EX_METAL on macOS)
praise_themes: Well-organized issue tracking with clear labels and platform categorization
Detailed technical descriptions with code references and visual evidence
Active engagement with constructive discussion (4-8 comments per issue)
sentiment.summary: wxWidgets shows healthy community activity with active engagement on technical issues, primarily focused on resolving high-DPI rendering challenges and platform-specific UI bugs rather than fundamental abandonment.

communication.summary: The maintainer's responses are highly helpful, clear, patient, and technically deep, making them an exemplary model for open-source communication.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite being a major UI framework
No merged pull requests in past 6 months indicates no active development
No closed issues in past 6 months suggests no maintenance activity
Large number of open issues (2291) with no resolution activity
No active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date raises questions about version management
positive_signals: Last commit exists (2026-01-25), showing the repository hasn't been deleted
No open PRs suggests the project isn't accepting new changes
maintenance.summary: wxWidgets appears to be in a stale state with no maintenance activity for at least 6 months despite a large backlog of unresolved issues.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The README provides a good introduction to wxWidgets, but lacks clear installation instructions and examples for new users.
concerns: Docs: Lack of clear and concise installation instructions and quick start guide
Security: Potential for command injection in wxCrashReport::SetFileName()
Security: Use of wxLaunchDefaultBrowser() with user-controlled input may lead to command injection
highlights: High number of commits in the past 6 months (739)
Large number of contributors active in the past 6 months (41)
Steady merge of PRs (92 merged in the past 6 months)
